question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Are Canadians watching the U.S. in 'horror and consternation,' as Prime Minister Trudeau says?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

answer.content: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Well, I\u2019m qualified to answer this. I\u2019m a Canadian, after all. I watched the entire response, not just the first part, so I\u2019ll respond accordingly.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "To the specific question, yes, I am watching with horror and consternation.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "I\u2019ve watched Donald Trump lean into the festering boil of US racism since 2015 with horror and consternation. After eight years of good governance and sanity with an eloquent, intelligent, competent and gracious black man as President, to have it overturned. I\u2019ve watched as hate crimes have soared under Trump. I\u2019ve watched as hate crimes spike in counties where he holds rallies. I\u2019ve watched as white supremacists praise him. I\u2019ve watched as Trump has enflamed racism and violence. I\u2019ve watched as he\u2019s encouraged the worst elements among the police to act in the worst ways.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "After the brutal deaths of Ahmaud Arbery and George Floyd, and the close call faced by Christian Cooper, I\u2019m amazed at the forbearance of the vast majority of the protestors. The overt and systemic racism that black people continue to face in the USA is appalling. And Trump is exploiting it for his own narcissistic ends. Black people are suffering under Trump, as are Asians and Jewish people and others. He\u2019s encouraging bigots to be violent, and then responding by attacking the protestors, a circle of violence that\u2019s hard to comprehend.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "horizontal-rule", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "But Trudeau said a lot more than than the initial sentence. He turned his words and gaze to Canada and Canadians, and our failings. We live in a glass house. We aren\u2019t perfect by any means. He pointed out clearly that black people and racialized people in Canada face systemic and often overt racism as well. And that we have to do better. We have to be allies. He used the challenging situation in the USA to challenge Canadians to be better ourselves.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "I\u2019ve written about the ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "weird confluence of privileges", "modifiers": {"link": {"type": "url", "url": "https://www.quora.com/What-privilege-are-you-not-ashamed-of-having/answer/Michael-Barnard-14?ch=10&share=076e8abf&srid=uvB8"}}}, {"text": " I was accidentally born with. I know how lucky I am, and I know the converse as well. The people born without all the marbles I had the good fortune to receive have to work a lot harder and smarter to get the opportunities that I have received.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Trudeau\u2019s response, formulated carefully and delivered eloquently, was the right one. He challenged me to do more. I\u2019ll try.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
